intro: Hieracium subprasinifolium, commonly known as the green-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky soils, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are broad, lance-shaped, and often have a bluish-green hue, while its flowers are yellow and bloom in summer. It is a perennial herb that spreads through rhizomes, forming dense colonies in its native habitat.
